lexUnit.name: signal.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: instruct or indicate by means of a signal.

sentence.text: She signalled that they should lower their voices and follow her round the building to a new window smashed through the wall of the cottage .
But Mr Jones signalled Mr Redwood was ready to make one compromise following protests at the decision to retain Powys .
` Brrrrr -- " he said as the Green Man signalled it was time to cross .
At the first note of the doorbell 's chime , Ursula swung round and signalled Charlotte to be silent .
She saw the night manager as the night manager saw her , and he quickly signalled her to go around and into his office .
“ Come , Fen … ” he said , signalling him to come closer .
He signalled Mariana to follow on foot and left one of the shotguns with her .
Knowing that I wanted to speak to the bedu woman to learn more of her life , the Sheikha signalled me to stay while they moved out of the dining room , pulling their veils over their masks .
Kragan signalled the officer to step back , then moved closer to Frick .
When they were about twenty yards from the house , Jackie signalled them to crouch down behind a large bush covered in strange waxen blooms , like roses , only they were n' t .
Simmons signalled her to an empty chair on the fringe of the disputatious group , and walked round the back of the table to take a chair opposite .
There is no reason why a male bird should signal accurate information to its competitors , except in so far as it will scare them away .
Several times she stopped , put down her shoe-parcel , and signalled a word with her flags .
Though he had signalled the blow , it still struck with paralysing force .
Then she began to signal her message -- slowly and carefully , letter by letter : J O E I N M A R S H.
Again and again Cheryl signalled the message , hoping desperately that Angela would read it .
